published_attributes.title: Performance Conversation Cycles
published_attributes.serialized_body:
This course is designed to help you navigate the updates and recent changes to Bridge's Performance Conversations feature. With these new updates, Bridge Administrators will have more control of performance cycle management and have access to past performance cycles via Performance Conversation Insights.

Let's get started!

Accessing Performance Conversations

To access Performance Conversations cycles, go to Admin, Performance Conversations.

Create New Cycle

Upload Employees for the PC Cycle

To create a Performance Conversation Cycle, you'll need to load a .csv file containing the employee IDs and the ID's of the reviewers for the cycle you're creating. If you're reviewing all employees during the PC cycle, you can easily create this .csv file by selecting "Download User List" make any modifications and then upload that file again using the "Add via CSV" link. Note: you must add all employees and reviewers using a .csv file, or the cycle cannot begin.

Fill in the details

Complete all the details for the new Performance Conversations cycle beginning with Cycle Name. Next, you'll choose the cycle type, either a Free Conversation or a Staged cycle. Free Conversations are less structured and ideal for informal reviews, all steps are to be completed between the specified start and end dates. Staged cycles are ideal for formal reviews, such as an end-of-year review. Stages include: Employee Review, Manager Review, Calibration, and Performance Conversation.

Stages

Performance conversation questions

The questions that appear on the Performance Conversation agenda are now located under the Questions tab on the Performance Conversations page. Nothing has changed with regard to the questions. This where you'll go to customize and add questions to the Performance Conversations agenda.

Rating Scale

A rating scale has been added to the Performance Conversations feature in Bridge. By default the ratings are turned off, but you can activate them for your entire organization if you choose. The ratings are a 1 to 5 scale ranging from "Does not meet expectations" to "Outstanding".

published_attributes.title: Performance Conversations changes for Managers
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Manager Access to Performance Conversations

Managers will access Performance Conversations from the main Bridge Screen called "Me". Performance Conversations relevant to an open PC cycle will be found under the "Growth" section of the main screen. In this scenario, Daryl, a manager is going to begin the Performance Conversation cycle for his team.

Clicking on the Performance Conversation tile under Growth on the main screen will give the manager a view of his team. This manager can access his self review for his own Performance Conversation with his manager, or click on the Start link next to one of his employees and begin the Performance Conversation process for that employee.

The manager will complete all sections of "Wins", "Plan", and "Other" to prepare the Performance Conversation Agenda. This includes, Goals, Feedback, Achievements and Learning.

When the manager has completed all sections of the Performance Conversation, he'll choose "Submit" and an agenda will be created.

Back at the Performance Conversation details page you can see that the employee, Donald, has yet to complete his portion of the Performance Conversation agenda. Once he's done that, the manager can "start" the actual conversation.

published_attributes.title: The Performance Conversation details page will show (select all that apply):

draft_attributes.title: The Performance Conversation details page will show (select all that apply):

published_attributes.title: Employee portion of the PC agenda
published_attributes.serialized_body:
The employee can find their version of the Performance Conversation on their landing page called "Me" under the "Growth" area. The employee will follow the same process as the manager in completing their portion.

Once both the manager and employee have completed and submitted their updates, the Performance Conversation agenda is created and ready for the conversation.

The manager can click "Start" to open the agenda and begin the conversation. Once the agenda appears, the manager can click "Start Conversation" in the upper right hand corner to commence the conversation with the employee.

Once the Performance Conversation is complete, the manager can click "Complete Conversation" to complete the Performance Conversation with that employee. The agenda will then be kept in History in Bridge.

The manager can return to the Performance Conversations page to see the status of this and any other Performance Conversations.

published_attributes.title: Performance Conversations - Insights
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Reporting on Performance Conversations is found in Insights.

This page will give summary and some detailed data about Performance Conversations by team.

Manager details from Insights.

published_attributes.title: Summary
published_attributes.serialized_body:
That concludes this course on Performance Conversations. You should now know how to:

  • Set up the Performance Conversations Cycle
  • Complete both the manager and employee reviews
  • Create a Performance Conversation Agenda
  • Complete the Performance Conversation Agenda
  • View details in Insights

For more information on Performance Conversations go to the Bridge Help Center.
